description: From Japanese 苦無 (くない, kunai).

entries.meaning: A Japanese tool and weapon, possibly derived from the masonry trowel, used as a weapon by ninja or samurai.

description: From Tok Pisin kunai (“grass, grassland”), from Tolai kunəi (“long grass”).

entries.meaning: A species of grass, Imperata cylindrica, native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Australasia, Africa, and southern Europe, and widely introduced to the New World.
